definition[0]: a formal statement saying that something is true, especially one a witness makes in a court of law
example[0]: Barker’s testimony is crucial to the prosecution’s case.
example[1]: In his testimony, he denied that the company had ignored safety procedures.
definition[1]: a fact or situation that shows or proves very clearly that something exists or is true
example[2]: These results are a testimony to the coach’s skill and hard work.
definition[2]: a formal statement that something is true, such as the one a WITNESS makes in a court of law
example[3]: In her testimony, she denied that she knew about the transactions.
example[4]: A federal grand jury has called a number of witnesses to give testimony in the pension-fund case.
